alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Central and Southeast Park County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 6:20PM MST until February 03 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SNOW, SLICK AND HAZARDOUS TRAVEL, AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .An extended period of snow, colder temperatures, and slick and hazardous travel conditions can be expected through Wednesday. A slow moving storm system will keep snow falling through Wednesday. Snow will increase across the Front Range, I-25 Corridor, and adjacent plains this evening, and spread eastward. Snow intensity in most areas will be heaviest this evening, but light snow will continue overnight and through Wednesday evening. Significant snow may last longer along the base of the foothills. The snow will come to an end Wednesday evening, but temperatures will be very cold. For the latest road conditions, go to cotrip.org or dial 511. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 4 to 7 inches. * WHERE...South Park, Denver, Castle Rock, and Greeley. * WHEN...Snow will be heaviest overnight, with a gradual decrease during the day Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous through Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination. Consider altering your travel plans. Snowfall is expected to make travel difficult.
